Class RestaurantManagementController

java.lang.Object
controllers.RestaurantManagementController
public class RestaurantManagementController extends Object
Controller responsible for managing restaurant configuration settings.

This controller handles operations related to:

  • Table management (add, update, delete tables)
  • Opening hours management (configure regular weekly hours)
  • Date overrides (special hours or closures for specific dates)
All operations interact with the database through the DBController.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Yamen Abu Ahmad

      Returns:
      a list of all tables with their numbers and capacities
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • addTable

      public common.dto.RestaurantManagement.RestaurantManagementResult addTable(int seats) throws SQLException
      Adds a new table to the restaurant.
      Parameters:
      seats - the seating capacity of the new table (must be positive)
      Returns:
      the result containing the new table number on success
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • updateTable

      Updates the seating capacity of an existing table.
      Parameters:
      tableNumber - the table number to update
      newSeats - the new seating capacity (must be positive)
      Returns:
      the result indicating success or failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • deleteTable

      public common.dto.RestaurantManagement.RestaurantManagementResult deleteTable(int tableNumber) throws SQLException
      Deletes a table from the restaurant.

      Tables that are currently in use (have active reservations) cannot be deleted.

      Parameters:
      tableNumber - the table number to delete
      Returns:
      the result indicating success or failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

      public common.dto.RestaurantManagement.RestaurantManagementResult updateOpeningHours(DayOfWeek day, LocalTime openTime, LocalTime closeTime, boolean closed) throws SQLException
      Updates the opening hours for a specific day of the week.
      Parameters:
      day - the day of the week to update
      openTime - the opening time (required if not closed)
      closeTime - the closing time (required if not closed)
      closed - whether the restaurant is closed on this day

      the result indicating success or failure
      Throws:

    • addDateOverride

      public common.dto.RestaurantManagement.RestaurantManagementResult addDateOverride(LocalDate date, LocalTime openTime, LocalTime closeTime, boolean closed, String reason) throws SQLException
      Adds a date-specific override for restaurant hours.

      Date overrides take precedence over regular weekly opening hours. They can be used for holidays, special events, or temporary closures.

      Parameters:
      date - the date for the override
      openTime - the opening time (required if not closed)
      closeTime - the closing time (required if not closed)
      closed - whether the restaurant is closed on this date
      reason - optional reason for the override
      Returns:
      the result containing the new override ID on success
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • updateDateOverride

      public common.dto.RestaurantManagement.RestaurantManagementResult updateDateOverride(int id, LocalDate date, LocalTime openTime, LocalTime closeTime, boolean closed, String reason) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing date override.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the override to update
      date - the date for the override
      openTime - the opening time (required if not closed)
      closeTime - the closing time (required if not closed)
      closed - whether the restaurant is closed on this date
      reason - optional reason for the override
      Returns:
      the result indicating success or failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs
